name: places/ChIJG6ygPvRZwokRLj82uckCIMk
formattedAddress: 70 Vestry St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 70 Vestry St, New York, NY 10013-1719, USA

originalText.text:
70 Vestry is 14 Stories, 46 residences and was built in 2018. Situated in the perfect TriBeCa location. Long considered one the most exclusive condominium buildings downtown visit for yourself and you will see why. Its gated porte-cochère with sentry leads to the elegant private courtyard, as well as the double-height lobby with hand-crafted furniture and commissioned artwork.

70 Vestry offers once-in-a-generation waterfront homes with Hudson River Park at your door and unobstructed, panoramic river views. Developed by Related Companies, 70 Vestry is designed by the legendary Robert A. M. Stern Architects,  Inside, AD100 designer Daniel Romualdez has created distinctively modern and warm interiors using unique materials and inventive methods.

70 Vestry offers a complete lifestyle package with over 12,000 square feet of unprecedented amenities, including a wellness level with an 82 foot swimming pool, separate children’s pool, hot and cold plunge pools, steam room and sauna, fitness center by The Wright Fit and a private regulation squash court. Its procession of entertaining spaces offers a café, library, billiards room and lounge and dining suite for seated dinners and cocktail parties, all furnished with 70 Vestry’s signature pairing of classic and contemporary pieces.

Residences range from approximately 2,400 to over 7,000 square feet and include two- to seven- bedroom layouts. Many homes feature libraries, family rooms and studies – and a number of residences also include fireplaces and generous setback terraces with Hudson River views. #whoyourbrokerismatters

originalText.text: A fabulous, kind, and happy building. Staff are professional and helpful. Pet friendly... I love 70 vestry

text.text: A fabulous, kind, and happy building. Staff are professional and helpful. Pet friendly... I love 70 vestry

originalText.text: I used to walk down Vestry Street almost everyday when I lived in Tribeca on my way to the waterfront.  Back then it was more industrial. Lot of spice shops, and factories. Back then, the meat-packing district actually packed meat and stank horribly.  For those who now live at the current Waterfront Condo building, you might be surprised what use to exist in that footprint.  I painted a portrait of this place in my series on 'Disappearing New York', which you can see or order prints on my website, kovalfineart dot com.

originalText.text: It's a very nice place to live
